option.desc: University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences
University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences
Drugs/Biologics (Includes both investigational and non-investigational products)
Nutritional Products (includes dietary supplements, medical foods, and infant formulas)
Devices (Includes both unapproved products and approved products used in non-approved ways)
N/A (Includes chart reviews and other biomedical/clinical research that does not involve drugs/biologics, nutritional products, or devices)
Consent for Pediatric Populations/ Parental Permission- FORM
Consent for Pediatric Populations/ Parental Permission- VERBAL SCRIPT
Informed Consent (NOT including HIPAA authorization)- FORM
Translated Informed Consent/Assent (including HIPAA authorization)- FORM
Translated Informed Consent/Assent (NOT including HIPAA authorization)- FORM
Limited Data Set Use Agreement Translation
Not greater than minimal risk---prospect of direct benefit for the woman and/or fetus
Not greater than minimal risk---without prospect of direct benefit but the purpose of the research is development of important knowledge that cannot be obtained by any other means
Greater than minimal risk---caused solely by procedures that hold the prospect of direct benefit for the woman and/or fetus
The least possible risk to achieve the research objective and the research holds the prospect of enhancing the probability of survival to the point of viability
No added risk will result from the research and the purpose of the research is development of important knowledge that cannot be obtained by other means

This research will examine the possible causes, effects, or processes of incarceration and/or criminal behavior, provided the study presents no more than minimal risk or inconvenience to the participants.
This research will examine prisons as institutional structures or prisoners as incarcerated persons, provided the study presents no more than minimal risk or inconvenience to the participants.

This research will examine a condition(s) particularly affecting prisoners as a class of people (for example, vaccine trials and other research on hepatitis which is much more prevalent in prisons than elsewhere; and research on social and psychological problems such as alcoholism, drug addiction, and sexual assaults).
This research will examine practices, both innovative and accepted, which have the intent and reasonable probability of improving the health or well-being of the participant.

This research is an epidemiologic study (1) to describe the prevalence or incidence of a disease by identifying all cases, or (2) to examine potential risk factor associations for a disease, provided the study presents no more than minimal risk or inconvenience to the participants and prisoners are not a particular focus of the research.

More than minimal risk is presented by an intervention or procedure that holds the prospect of direct benefit for the individual child, or by a monitoring procedure that is likely to contribute to the child's well-being.

More than minimal risk is presented by an intervention or procedure that does not hold the prospect of direct benefit for the individual child, or by a monitoring procedure that is not likely to contribute to the child's well-being.
Greater than minimal risk with the prospect of direct benefit for the individual
Greater than minimal risk without the prospect of direct benefit for the individual
Names; dates; phone numbers; email addresses; street addresses; cities; zip codes; social security numbers; medical records numbers
Ages over 89; fax numbers; counties; precincts; health plan beneficiary numbers; account numbers
Voices; images; other biometric identifiers, including finger prints and retinal prints
Certificates/license numbers; vehicle identifiers and serial numbers, including license place numbers; device identifiers and serial numbers; URLs; IP addresses

Other
Please explain what other data sources you are using.
Alliance - Alliance for Clinical Trials Oncology
No designated support for this study
Research Labs (e.g., exercise facility, BioMed I, etc.)
To determine incidence/prevalence of disease (epidemiologic trial)
To determine risk factors for disease/outcomes (epidemiologic trial)
To study natural history of disease (epidemiologic trial)
To ameliorate disease effects (supportive care trial)
To detect disease in preclinical course (screening trial)
To detect disease with improved accuracy (diagnostic trial)
Local Investigators (e.g., researchers at UAMS, ACH)
Other, please explain (i.e. by dosing level, number of subjects enrolled, etc.)
Retrospective study using existing data (chart review, sample bank, etc.)
Study collecting tissue or blood for in vitro experiments not related to patient data or outcome.
Study assembling repositories (banking) tissue, data, or samples for unspecified future use.
Pedigree study (to discover the pattern of inheritance of a disease and to catalog the range of symptoms involved)
Positional cloning study (to localize and identify specific genes)
DNA diagnostic study (to develop techniques for determining the presence of specific DNA mutations
Gene therapy research (to develop treatments for genetic disease at the DNA level)
Somatic (non-inherited mutation expected to be present only in the tissue being studied)
Experimentation using carcinogenic (known or suspected) compounds

All of the following accurately describe your research
  • a. The research is permanently closed to the enrollment of new subjects
  • b. All subjects have completed all research related interventions
  • c. The research remains active only for long-term follow-up of subjects
The remaining research activities are limited to data analysis only.
No subject has been enrolled, no risk has been identified.
No subjects have been enrolled, no risks have been identified.

The research is permanently closed to the enrollment of new subjects, all subjects have completed all research related interventions, and the research remains active only for long-term follow-up of subjects.

The research is permanently closed to the enrollment of new subjects, all subjects have completed all research related interventions, and the remaining research activities are limited to data analysis only.

The research is permanently closed to the enrollment of new subjects, all subjects have completed all research related interventions, and collection and analysis of private identifiable information is completed.
The research is permanently closed to the enrollment of new subjects, but all subjects have not completed research-related interventions.
The study is open and accrual is ongoing.
Protocol deviation to eliminate immediate apparent harm
Incarceration of a subject in a study not approved for the enrollment of prisoners
Change in FDA labeling or withdrawal of drug, device, or biologic used in the research protocol
Restriction, suspension or termination of the study
Notification of pending audit, inquiry or investigation by federal agency
No subjects have been enrolled, no risks have been identified.

The research is permanently closed to the enrollment of new subjects, all subjects have completed all research related interventions, and collection and analysis of private identifiable information is completed.
Study terminated early due to safety concerns
Study terminated early due to slow accrual
Study closed due to sponsor withdrawal
HIPAA Data Use Agreement (Limited Data Set)
Sponsored CTA: Protocol created by sponsor
PI Initiated CTA: Protocol created by UAMS PI (externally funded or drug/device provided by company)
Cooperative Group CTA (SWOG, GOG, NSABP, etc)
PI Initiated Research: Scope of Work created by UAMS PI (externally funded or drug/device provided by company)
Sponsored Research: Protocol created by Sponsor
UAMS is primary contactor (subcontract covers work done for UAMS by another party)
Human embryonic stem cells (hESC), adult human stem cells, pluripotent cells or somatic nuclear transplantation
Local Investigators (e.g., researchers at UAMS, ACH)
To develop or contribute to generalizable knowledge (to extend outside the local context)
To evaluate an existing program or practice and to use the findings within the institution to improve the practice or program (note that this aim does not preclude publication)
